db:abstract.db:para: The Qt Core module is part of Qt's essential modules.

db:section.db:title: Core Functionalities
db:section.db:para: Qt Core adds these features to C++:

db:listitem.db:para: a very powerful mechanism for seamless object communication called signals and slots
hierarchical and queryable object trees that organize
object ownership in a natural way with guarded pointers (QPointer)
a dynamic cast that works across library boundaries

db:section.db:para: The following pages provide more information about Qt's core features:

db:section.db:title: Using the Module
db:section.db:para: Using a Qt module requires linking against the module library, either directly or through other dependencies. Several build tools have dedicated support for this, including CMake and qmake.

db:section.db:title: Building with CMake
db:section.db:para: Use the find_package() command to locate the needed module components in the Qt5 package:
db:section.db:programlisting: find_package(Qt5 COMPONENTS Core REQUIRED) target_link_libraries(mytarget Qt5::Core)
db:section.db:para: See also the Building with CMake overview.

db:section.db:title: Building with qmake
db:section.db:para: If you use qmake to build your projects, Qt5Core is linked by default.

db:section.db:title: Threading and Concurrent Programming
db:section.db:para: Qt provides thread support in the form of platform-independent threading classes, a thread-safe way of posting events, and signal-slot connections across threads. Multithreaded programming is also a useful paradigm for performing time-consuming operations without freezing the user interface of an application.
The Thread Support in Qt page contains information on implementing threads in applications. Additional concurrent classes are provided by the Qt Concurrent module.

db:section.db:title: Input/Output, Resources, and Containers
db:section.db:para: Qt provides a resource system for organizing application files and assets, a set of containers, and classes for receiving input and printing output.
In addition, Qt Core provides a platform-independent mechanism for storing binary files in the application's executable.

db:section.db:title: Additional Frameworks
db:section.db:para: Qt Core also provides some of Qt's key frameworks.
